footballAPI module¶

footballAPI.getCompetitions()¶

getCompetitions will return you all the competition that the API have.

Format json which are returned : “country_name”: x[‘country_name’] –> name of the country. “league_id”: x[‘league_id’] –> Unique ID of the competition (needed for few other requests) “league_name”: x[‘league_name’], –> name of the league. :rtype: object

footballAPI.getLeagueByName(countryName, leagueName)¶

getLeagueByName which will return to you the index or not of the league that you are given in argument.

Parameters

  • countryName – name of the country you need to target.

  • leagueName – competition name you need to target in the country.

Returns

-1 if error and >= 0 if something are found.

footballAPI.liveScore()¶

liveScore is the route which will be called when the user want to know actual live score of the popular competitions match in the world of the football today.

this route needed two different arguments :

@country = the country that you target.

@league = the competition name that you target in the country chosen.

An exemple with this route :

url : “http://127.0.0.1:5000/services/football/live”

league=Ligue 1

country=France

url + param : http://127.0.0.1:5000/services/football/live?league=Coupe de la Ligue

An example of output :

“match_hometeam_name”:”Amiens”,

“match_hometeam_score”:”3”,

“match_awayteam_name”:”Angers”,

“match_awayteam_score”:”2”

return

The function will return a list of dict which will contained this kind of variable : name of the club [HOME] score of the club [HOME] name of the club [AWAY] score of the club [AWAY] If there is no event today the API will return this kind of json : “error”: 404, “message”: “No event found (please check your plan)!”

footballAPI.rankLeague()¶

rankLeague is the route which will be called when the user want to know the rank of the popular competition in the world of the football.

this route needed two different arguments :

@country = the country that you target.

@league = the competition name that you target in the country chosen.

An exemple with this route : url : “http://127.0.0.1:5000/services/football/rank”

league=Ligue 1

country=France

url + param : http://127.0.0.1:5000/services/football/rank?league=Ligue 1&country=France

An example of output :

“name”:”Paris SG”,

“position”:”1”,

“match_played”:”11”,

“match_winned”:”9”,

“match_draw”:”0”,

“match_loosed”:”2”

next: “name”:”Nantes”,

“position”:”2”,

“match_played”:”11”,

“match_winned”:”6”,

“match_draw”:”1”,

“match_loosed”:”4”

Returns

The function will return a list of dict which will contained this kind of variable.

⚫ name of the club.

⚫ position in the ranking (sort in order by default).

⚫ count of played match.

⚫ count of won match.

⚫ count of draw match.

⚫ count of loosed match.

If there is problem with the name of the country or the league our API will return this kind of json : { “error”: 404, “message”: “No league found (please check your plan)!!” }
